docs.lead_paragraph: Could exercise actually be bad for some healthy people? A well-known group of researchers, including one who helped write the scientific paper justifying national guidelines that promote exercise for all, say the answer may be a qualified yes. By analyzing data from six rigorous exercise studies involving 1,687 people, the group found that about 10 percent actually got worse on at least one of the measures related to heart disease:blood pressure and levels of insulin, HDL cholesterolortriglycerides. About 7 percent got worse on at least two measures. And the researchers say they do not know why.

headline.main: For Some, Exercise May Increase Heart Risks, Researchers Find

docs.abstract: Study published in the journal PLoS One finds exercise for some people may increase heart risks; well-known group of researchers, by analyzing data from six rigorous exercise studies involving 1,687 people, finds that about 10 percent actually got worse on at least one of the measures related to heart disease. Photos (M)1

headline.main: Should Latin America End the War on Drugs?

docs.abstract: Instead of an ever-escalating war, governments could approach drugs as a public health issue. Would that reduce the body count?

headline.main: For Some, Exercise May Increase Heart Risk
headline.print_headline: For Some, Exercise May Increase Heart Risks, Researchers Find

docs.abstract: Researchers have found evidence that some people who exercise do worse on measures related to heart disease.
